description.narrative: - Job creation and employee skills development. The Project will create up to 2,600 new jobs, most of which will be for women, the majority of whom are uneducated and have limited earning opportunities. - Contribution to economic growth. The textile and apparel sector is one of the sectors where Haiti currently has a strong competitive advantage. The Project will thus contribute to economic growth in Haiti. It will generate significant foreign currency cash flows given its export focus, helping Haiti reduce its trade deficit. - Demonstration effect. The project will demonstrate to other foreign investors that despite various challenges, Haiti remains an attractive investment location for textile and apparel operations.

Ltd., a South Korean garment manufacturer in setting up its first manufacturing operating in Haiti. Hansae currently exports approximately 300 million pieces of clothing per year from 11 production facilities in 5 countries: Nicaragua, Guatemala, Indonesia, Myanmar and Vietnam. Phase 1 of the Haiti project entails the establishing of a cutting and sewing plant of up to 44 production lines in the Sonapi (Societe Nationale des Parcs Industriels) industrial park in Port-au-Prince.
